Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the number of Nigerian women who died from cervical cancer in 2008, as the data cannot be proven and the provided data from 2012 is incorrect.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the data provided by the expert is not verifiable and may be inaccurate.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in cervical cancer cases in Nigeria is solely due to the Covid-19 pandemic, without considering other factors that may contribute to the increase.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the increase in cervical cancer cases in Nigeria, other than just the Covid-19 pandemic, which are not addressed in the claim.
